title: Mrs. Mary Chinery-Hesse | University of Ghana

organizations.name: University of Ghana
quotes: She holds an Honours Degree from the University of Ghana in Sociology and Economics.

organizations.name: University of Dublin
quotes: She pursued Post-Graduate programmes in Development Economics at the University of Dublin and at the World Bank Institute in Washington D.C.

organizations.name: World Bank Institute
quotes: She pursued Post-Graduate programmes in Development Economics at the University of Dublin and at the World Bank Institute in Washington D.C. where she was inscribed as a Fellow of the Institute.

organizations.name: Wesley Girls' High School
quotes: She is an Old Girl of Wesley Girls' High School and Mfantsipim School.

organizations.name: Mfantsipim School
quotes: She is an Old Girl of Wesley Girls' High School and Mfantsipim School.

organizations.name: United Nations
quotes: Mrs. Mary Chinery-Hesse has had distinguished careers in Ghana’s Civil Service and at the United Nations.

organizations.name: UN Systems
quotes: She was the first African woman to be appointed Resident Coordinator of the UN Systems and Resident Representative of the United Nations Development Programme,

organizations.name: United Nations Development Programme
quotes: She was the first African woman to be appointed Resident Coordinator of the UN Systems and Resident Representative of the United Nations Development Programme,

organizations.name: International Labour Organization (ILO)
quotes: the first woman Deputy Director-General of the International Labour Organization (ILO), a position with the rank of Under Secretary-General of the UN.

organizations.name: UN's Consultative Committee on Programme and Operational Questions
quotes: She also served as Chairperson of the UN's Consultative Committee on Programme and Operational Questions for several years

organizations.name: Commonwealth Expert Group of Eminent Persons on Structural Adjustment and Women
quotes: and was the Chairperson of the Commonwealth Expert Gro-up of Eminent Persons on Structural Adjustment and Women, which produced the landmark Report, “Engendering Adjustment”.

organizations.name: Council of African Advisors of the World Bank
quotes: She has served on numerous high-profile boards, committees and commissions, including the following -the Council of African Advisors of the World Bank and the Eminent Persons' Advisory Panel of the Organization of African Unity which crafted the strategy to convert the OAU to

Chancellor

roles.title: Resident Coordinator of the UN Systems
quotes: She was the first African woman to be appointed Resident Coordinator of the UN Systems and Resident Representative of the United Nations Development Programme,

roles.title: Resident Representative of the United Nations Development Programme
quotes: She was the first African woman to be appointed Resident Coordinator of the UN Systems and Resident Representative of the United Nations Development Programme,

roles.title: Deputy Director-General of the International Labour Organization (ILO)
quotes: the first woman Deputy Director-General of the International Labour Organization (ILO), a position with the rank of Under Secretary-General of the UN.

roles.title: Under Secretary-General of the UN
quotes: the first woman Deputy Director-General of the International Labour Organization (ILO), a position with the rank of Under Secretary-General of the UN.

roles.title: Chairperson of the UN's Consultative Committee on Programme and Operational Questions
quotes: She also served as Chairperson of the UN's Consultative Committee on Programme and Operational Questions for several years

roles.title: Chairperson of the Commonwealth Expert Group of Eminent Persons on Structural Adjustment and Women
quotes: and was the Chairperson of the Commonwealth Expert Gro-up of Eminent Persons on Structural Adjustment and Women, which produced the landmark Report, “Engendering Adjustment”.
Mrs. Mary Chinery-Hesse has had distinguished careers in Ghana’s Civil Service and at the United Nations.
She pursued Post-Graduate programmes in Development Economics at the University of Dublin and at the World Bank Institute in Washington D.C. where she was inscribed as a Fellow of the Institute.
